Blog.post: *** A happy one. I love this feeling, like I'm on top of the world. With the universe in the palm of my hand, the stars in my eyes. I love being able to look in the mirror, without shame- sleeping without a dose of tears. I love being able to smile, without faking warmth; to dream without fears. To not wear a mask of satisfaction, and an armor of untold secrets. I love being able to breath without drowning; to live without frowning. I love being able to reach down and touch my heart, knowing the scars are gone. But, most of all, I love remembering how to live. November 18, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my rhyme, my word, my verse.

*** don't shove me into a Paxil world just because I cry just because I sit in tears doesn't mean I wish to die don't hurt me like I fear you will or love me without care I know what pain feel like so love me if you dare don't say you'll stay for all of time don't promise as you hold me close your heart beating next to mine don't let me fall too fast until red is all I see I have begun to learn love can be a paradise but those three words can burn. April 19, 2004 Insomniac Poetry is creativity, my hostility, my worth.

*** I happen to actually like this one; even if it is a bit....um.....morbid. Kill me while I sleep Kill me while I dream of this place Let me die before I wake And stand before death's dark face Let me slip away Like sand through your fingers To a place all alone Where life no longer lingers Let me fulfill my destiny And take death's last kiss- Fade away slowly In the Reeper's clenched fist April 24, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my pursuance, my purpose, my horizon.

*** Um...yeah...this one's kinda dumb. But...hey, it's not suicidal! That's a step up, right? letting the drops slide off my body spinning in a shower of endless perilt wirling in a mist of boundless doubts droplets falling to the ground gliding over my skin slick and smooth wet against my lips cold against my heart washing over my soul leaving me in peace dancing in the rain July 6, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my sight, my opinion, my voice.

*** I wish i could remember to learn to trust again replenish this light inside that has grown so dim I wish I could close my eyes and remember how to sleep clench my fists tight and forget how to weep I wish I could stop these dreams and burn the memory reels shut down my heart ignore what it feels I wish I could find someone to love me completely a love to call my own someone for all eternity December 2, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my love, my devotion, my escape.

*** Wow...this is happy poem....now, where'd that come from? It's a bit prosy...but, oh well. It's my creativity. I am my own critic. step out of line sing out tune try and count the stars dance under the moon reach to your depths do the undoable try the impossible move the unmoveable paint your own picture build your own path and when you cry make sure to laugh shine in the darkests parkle in the dullest grin without regret live life to the fullest May 11, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my destruction, my obscurity, my pursuit.

*** The title is self explanatory. Lurking Hiding Searching-- for the perfect victim Restless Impatient BloodThirsty Blending into the shadows Mixing with the dark Lips a rose red-- form a slow smile Eyes dart daringly Bending low- unnoticed- unseen Ready to strike About to pounce- unstoppable- invincible Overcome by hunger Time is slipping Sunrise is coming- The moon is sinking Here's the chance- Attack! June 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my oblivion, my reflection , my confession.

*** This one is definitely a morbid piece. don't say you've never been there down that dark lonely road so lost and alone to the point where you just can't take anymore to the moment where you're numb on the edge a turning point a changing time seems to slow- just to draw out your pain just to laugh in your face you're to the point where the agony of death seems inferior you don't know what to do anymore you don't know what to say anymore you've caused so much... now you sit through the effects not wanting to exist burned by your thoughts trapped clawing at the inside of your coffin digging yourself deeper pushing away love secluding yourself darkening your mind shadow over your soul bleeding though your heart death wishes playing in your thoughts dancing, taunting.. consumed by evil... don't say you've never been there May 17, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my beligerance, my ignorance, my truth.

*** This is one of the first poems that I ever wrote. My muse was a guy I knew whose heart was a chamber of depression and rage. The frustration of hoping he wouldn't hurt himself poured out of me in the form of these words... On the edge of the knife turning his back on the world emotions poisoned anger unfurled venom flows in his veins hatred pierces his mind convinced he is not worthy that love, he'll never find his heart locked in the unbreakable coldness lost in the intensity of his eternal hopelessness no reason to live no reason to die trapped by his bitterness never free to fly wishing to take his last breath craving to no longer exist to evaporate like a breathless dust to disappear like a forgotten mist to feel the cold metal piece slice accross his warm skin wanting a painless existence his patience wears thin yearning to sense his own life leaking slowly away into the gaping hole diminish like a fading ray to be lost like the burnt out embers never to return never to remember April 2003

** * My first post--we'll mark this day down in history. I have decided to use this blog to post my poetry ( I have a seperate blog which I use just for fun ). This is the place where I can let my creativity spill, without succoming to ill placed criticism and cruel remarks. Here, I have an alias to hide behind. I can say what I want, and write what I feel. To those who read my writings, I hope you enjoy them. By the way, feel free to comment, I love chatting.

*** here I stand right before you falling, arms wide open eyes closed tight arms crossed over my chest ...will you be there to catch me? August 16th, 2004 Insomniac poetry is my emotion, my expression, my beauty

*** Just a bit I wrote yesterday. knowing I could love you forever as I tickle you playfully your hands pinned beneath mine tired and grinning, I steal a kiss one by one thinking I could stay forever as you hold me tight heart pounding in your chest running my fingers through your hair as a trail of butterfly kisses lace your lips wishing I could watch you forever as your eyelids flutter shut I caress your cheek as your quiet breath grows steady and as your heart beat lulls me to sleep I know I'll love you forever August 4, 2004 Insomniac Poetry is my soul, my spirit, my heart.

*** love me hate me what's your pick? when i look into your eyes you smother me in affection such a perfect love yet, once I'm gone ice cold hate fills your every word long ago, I gave up turning my cheek long ago, I gave up bowing to my knees kiss me slap me the choice is yours to make the pain is mine to bear do I mean a thing? how much would you give to keep me? why can't you at least pretend to love me? deja vu because here you go again cutting me cursing me as if you crave my tears as if you test my strength is my pain your love? you don't want to see me cry but, if you cut me once more you'll just have to shut your eyes August 3, 2004 Insomniac Poetry is my pain, my glory, my anguish.

*** let my heart spill like an endless flood let my eyes fill and rain tears of blood shake the stars so that the heavens will fall take my heart as yours for now and for all let this dream fade like a lifelong mist wake this slumber... and the love that exists April 2, 2004 Insomniac Poetry is my outrage, my hatred, my fire.

*** This one is ...basically about my envy over 'fireflies'...(dont' ask)..but, it has more meaning than that, which is why I chose to post it. staring out this window eyes sinking in the dusk watching little globes of light twinkle though the still flowing along smoothly like torrid liquid through the nite graceful in each movement alive, quite alive hand against the window pane loathing quiet leisure wishing for free rein that of which I cannot have a sentry frozen still stone gaze holding fast as they stream through the sky; a lighted path up to Heaven August 3, 2004 Insomniac Poetry is my anxiety, my veracity, my dignity.

*** I wrote this one while I was in Tennessee. Its layout is different from most of my other poems, which is precisely why I like it. round and round the carousel goes what happens when it stops? noone truly knows grasp me by the wrists let's play tug of war walk down life's hall and choose your final door knock once now knock twice a rap of three would surely suffice sing me a song as we dance among the flowers harmonies of innocense and what your heart devours you and I shall have our dance twirling softly in our own ambiance I think I'll blow bubbles at the heavens skidding accross stars and life's deep deceptions now fly away so meek and airy on blood of a unicorn and wings of a fairy close your eyes against torrential rain and kiss me quick on lover's lane and now color me pure like a sinless dove clip these fierce wings as I bow down to love June 15, 04 Insomniac Poetry is my silence, my pestilence, my intensity.

*** Wow...a non morbid one...where'd that come from? love me tender love me deeply hush my stained lips as I whisper sweetly watch me closely behind quiet eyes look deep within me beyond this disguise smother me in kisses feather light upon my lips fill my ears gently with soft sentiments now carve me a heart softly upon my soul lend me your love to make me whole December 1-2, 2003 Insomniac Poetry is my life, my edge, my vision.
